title: How to Remove Butter or Grease Stains from a Carpet

steps.headline: Prevent people or pets from walking on the butter or grease stain.
steps.description: Place a marker such as a book or a container, a chair or small table over or next to the stain area to prevent walking onto it while you gather the cleaning supplies.

steps.headline: Scrape off as much as possible.
steps.description: Do this very gently, so as not to rub any more of the grease into the carpet. Use the side of a butter knife to do this.

steps.headline: Sprinkle cornmeal over the stain.
steps.description: Do not rub this in; simply sprinkle it right over the butter or grease stain.

steps.headline: Leave for up to half an hour to soak up the butter or grease.
Vacuum as usual.
steps.description: The stain should lift with the cornmeal.

text: Prevent people or pets from walking on the butter or grease stain. Place a marker such as a book or a container, a chair or small table over or next to the stain area to prevent walking onto it while you gather the cleaning supplies. Scrape off as much as possible. Do this very gently, so as not to rub any more of the grease into the carpet. Use the side of a butter knife to do this. Sprinkle cornmeal over the stain. Do not rub this in; simply sprinkle it right over the butter or grease stain. Leave for up to half an hour to soak up the butter or grease.  Vacuum as usual. The stain should lift with the cornmeal.
